abstract: Federal appeals court rules that New York law firm Skadden, Arps, Slate, Meagher & Flom could owe overtime pay to contract lawyer who performed nonlegal work; decision could increase costs for firms that hire temporary lawyers.
lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court said on Thursday that the New York law firm Skadden, Arps, Slate, Meagher & Flom may owe overtime pay to a contract lawyer for performing nonlegal work.

headline.main: Skadden Law Firm May Be Required to Pay Overtime for Contract Lawyers
headline.print_headline: Firm May Be Required to Pay Overtime for Contract Lawyers

snippet: A federal appeals court said on Thursday that the New York law firm Skadden, Arps, Slate, Meagher & Flom may owe overtime pay to a contract lawyer for performing nonlegal work.
